intellimate.izou.contentgenerator

Class ContentGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.contentgenerator.ContentGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceBuilder, Identifiable, ExceptionCallback

    public abstract class ContentGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceBuilder, ExceptionCallback
    The Task of an ContentGenerator is to generate a Resources-Object when a Event it subscribed to was fired.

    When an Event this ContentGenerator subscribed to was fired, the ContentGeneratorManager will run the instance of it in a ThreadPool and generate(String eventID) will be called.

        public abstract java.util.List<Resource> announceResources()
        this method is called to register what resources the object provides. just pass a List of Resources without Data in it.

      • provideResource

        public abstract java.util.List<Resource> provideResource(java.util.List<Resource> resources,
                                                         java.util.Optional<Event> event)
        this method is called when an object wants to get a Resource. it has as an argument resource instances without data, which just need to get populated.
        Specified by:
        provideResource in interface ResourceBuilder
        Parameters:
        resources - a list of resources without data
        event - if an event caused the action, it gets passed. It can also be null.
        Returns:
        a list of resources with data

      • exceptionThrown

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        An ID must always be unique. A Class like Activator or OutputPlugin can just provide their .class.getCanonicalName() If you have to implement this interface multiple times, just concatenate unique Strings to .class.getCanonicalName()
        Specified by:
        getID in interface Identifiable
        Returns:
        A String containing an ID
